glsa.title: Net-SNMP: fixproc insecure temporary file creation
glsa.synopsis: Net-SNMP creates temporary files in an insecure manner, possibly allowing the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Net-SNMP is a suite of applications used to implement the Simple Network Management Protocol.

description.p: The fixproc application of Net-SNMP creates temporary files with predictable filenames.

impact.p: A malicious local attacker could exploit a race condition to change the content of the temporary files before they are executed by fixproc, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code. A local attacker could also create symbolic links in the temporary files directory, pointing to a valid file somewhere on the filesystem. When fixproc is executed, this would result in the file being overwritten.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
